ABOUT P.I.O.
■what it means and what it does
P.I.O. stands for Public Information Office, and the duties and purpose
of this office are just what are implied by the title. It is the mission of this
office to make available to the public any and all information about Army
activities which might affect the general public. Many of these activities;
however, are quite broad in nature and do not necessarily fall into the
“spot” news category. We have found that one of the best means of ful¬
filling our mission of keeping the public informed about such activities
is thru the distribution of such radio programs as “Queen of Battle.”
ABOUT THE SHOW-some of the technical data
“Queen of Battle” is produced weekly and distributed each Tuesday by
first-class mail to individual subscribers. Series units of 13 shows each
are sent to distributing agents quarterly for distribution within their area
networks.
In addition to the regular weekly programming, special shows are sent
to each subscribing station for use during Christmas and Easter broad¬
casting periods. These shows are of a special nature and are designed to
fit in with the seasonal programming for which they are produced.
“Queen of Battle” is recorded chiefly on Ampex “600” tape recorders.
Only the highest quality microphones and field recording equipment is used
in order to produce shows of top calibre. Recordings are made at 7 1/2
inches per second. Voice closing on all shows is at 14:30 or less with
music extending 10 seconds.
Questions, suggestions and criticisms are welcome and appreciated.
Mail should be addressed to your distributing agent, or to Mr. William
W. Bryant; Chief, Radio-TV Branch; Information Section; Fort Benning, Ga.
